Article.Abstract: CD8(+) T cells could make an important contribution to protection against tuberculosis (TB), but the antigenic determinants recognized in the context of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules remain ill defined. Our aim was to identify nonamer peptides derived from the acr/16-kDa antigen. Two immunogenic peptides (p21-29 and p120-128) were identified by their ability to elicit cytotoxic CD8(+) T cells from juvenile patients recovering from TB. Epitope-specific recognition was demonstrated by the lysis of both Mycobacterium tuberculosis-infected and peptide-pulsed macrophages, the release of cytotoxic granules, and interferon-gamma and tumor necrosis factor-alpha production. CD8(+) T cell responses to p21-29 and p120-128 were detected ex vivo in freshly isolated peripheral blood mononuclear cells from patients with TB but not in those from healthy control subjects. Our data suggest that these antigenic peptides can play a critical role in effective immunity against mycobacterial infection and TB.
Article.ArticleTitle: Identification of epitopes of Mycobacterium tuberculosis 16-kDa protein recognized by human leukocyte antigen-A*0201 CD8(+) T lymphocytes.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Biopathology, University of Palermo, Palermo, Italy.

Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Antigens, Differentiation, T-Lymphocyte(biosynthesis); Bacterial Proteins(immunology); CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Child; Cytotoxicity, Immunologic; Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(analysis; chemistry); Female; Flow Cytometry; HLA-A Antigens(immunology); HLA-A2 Antigen; Humans; Interferon-gamma(biosynthesis); Macrophages(immunology; microbiology; pathology); Male; Membrane Glycoproteins(biosynthesis); Molecular Weight; Mycobacterium tuberculosis(immunology); Peptide Fragments(analysis); Perforin; Pore Forming Cytotoxic Proteins; Tuberculosis, Pulmonary(immunology); Tumor Necrosis Factor-alpha(biosynthesis)

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from healthy subjects were cultured and stimulated with autologous PBMCs pulsed with the peptide. CD8+ T cells were expanded in vitro in IL-2/CM supplemented with purified phytohemagglutinin and irradiated allogeneic feeder cells.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Production of TNF-α and IFN-γ were also positive. Peptides were further analyzed for the presence of intracellular cytokine release (IFN-γ, perforin and granulysin).

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Subjects had pulmonary TB, established by the presence of clinal symptoms of TB. PBMCs were isolated and CD8+ T lymphocytes were sorted by immunomagnetic beads. CD8+ T cells were expanded in vitro in IL-2/CM supplemented with purified phytohemagglutinin and irradiated allogeneic feeder cells.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Specific lysis was also seen in target cells (THP-1) infected with BCG (Bacille Calmette Guerin) vaccine or Mycobacterium tuberculosis strain H37Ra.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Freshly isolated CD8+ T cells were used harvested, washed and stained with quantum-red conjugated anti CD8 MAb in incubation buffer.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A CD8+ T cell response specific to the epitope was elicited during the course of M.tuberculosis infection in vivo.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Subjects had pulmonary TB, established by the presence of clinal symptoms of TB. PBMCs were isolated and CD8+ T lymphocytes were sorted by immunomagnetic beads. CD8+ T cells were expanded in vitro in IL-2/CM supplemented with purified phytohemagglutinin and irradiated allogeneic feeder cells.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Endogenous generation of the epitope during mycobacterial infection was demonstrated in two different experiments.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Subjects had pulmonary TB, established by the presence of clinal symptoms of TB. PBMCs were isolated and CD8+ T lymphocytes were sorted by immunomagnetic beads. CD8+ T cells were expanded in vitro in IL-2/CM supplemented with purified phytohemagglutinin and irradiated allogeneic feeder cells.

CD8+ T cells were expanded in vitro in IL-2/CM supplemented with purified phytohemagglutinin and irradiated allogeneic feeder cells.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A similar response was obtained for IFN-γ production. The CD8+ T cell response to the peptide was both CD8 and HLA-A*0201 mediated.
